required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of High-flow Nasal Oxygen During Awake Fiberoptic Bronchoscope Guided Intubation: A Retrospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of High-flow Nasal Oxygen During Awake Fiberoptic Bronchoscope Guided Intubation: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective data collection. The aim of this study is to investigate impact of high-flow nasal oxygen on safety(lowest oxygen saturation), efficiency (intubation time, need for multiple attempts) in patients underwent awake fiberoptic bronchoscope guided intubation.

primary_outcome.description: Intra-procedural lowest saturation: lowest oxygen saturation on pulse oximetry during awake intubation

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intra-procedural (need for multiple attempts : during awake intubation)
primary_outcome.description: need for multiple attempts : more than 2 attempts needed during awake intubation

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intra-procedural (Time taken for awake intubation: time from entering the operating room to completion of awake endotracheal intubation)
primary_outcome.description: Time taken for awake intubation: time from entering the operating room to completion of awake endotracheal intubation

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent awake fiberoptic bronchoscope guided intubation for surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1.Patients who underwent awake fiberoptic bronchoscope guided intubation for surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Cases in which other procedures (e.g. arterial line cannulation) were performed prior to endotracheal intubation after entering operation room
2. Patients with Incomplete records of oxygen saturation, attempt number, and time taken for awake intubation

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine
